data.fullContent: The first patent for a telephone was issued to Alexander Graham Bell in 1876. Beginning in 1877, Bell demonstrated the telephone to several judges and business people, none of whom were impressed by his invention. That same year, Bell and his financial backer, Gardiner Hubbard, established the Bell Telephone Company. The company was a combination of a manufacturing company and a telephone service. Together, they were able to demonstrate the usefulness of the telephone and demand for a telephone rapidly rose in the following years.The Bell System soon dominated telephone service in the United States.

q1.translation: 1876年，亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔获得了电话的第一个专利。从1877年开始，贝尔向几位法官和商界人士演示了电话，但没有一个人对他的发明印象深刻。
q1.front: The first patent for a telephone was issued to Alexander Graham Bell in 1876. Beginning in 1877, Bell demonstrated the telephone to several judges and business people, none of whom were impressed by his invention.
q1.content: The first ____ for a ____ was issued to Alexander Graham Bell in 1876. Beginning in 1877, Bell demonstrated the telephone ____ several judges and business people, none of whom were ____ by his invention.

q2.translation: 1876年，亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔获得了电话的第一个专利。从1877年开始，贝尔向几位法官和商界人士演示了电话，但没有一个人对他的发明印象深刻。同年，贝尔和他的财务赞助人加德纳·哈伯德成立了贝尔电话公司。这家公司是一家制造公司和电话服务公司的结合体。他们一起证明了电话的实用性，在接下来的几年里，对电话的需求迅速上升。贝尔系统很快就主导了美国的电话服务。
q2.front: The first patent for a telephone was issued to Alexander Graham Bell in 1876. Beginning in 1877, Bell demonstrated the telephone to several judges and business people, none of whom were impressed by his invention.
q2.middle: That same year, Bell and his financial backer, Gardiner Hubbard, established the Bell Telephone Company.
q2.ending: The company was a combination of a manufacturing company and a telephone service. Together, they were able to demonstrate the usefulness of the telephone and demand for a telephone rapidly rose in the following years.The Bell System soon dominated telephone service in the United States.

options.sentence: The telephone system was eventually expanded to connect many people using wires, and this is the system today.
Previously, operators used their own equipment to get the telephone numbers of the people they wanted to reach.
That same year, Bell and his financial backer, Gardiner Hubbard, established the Bell Telephone Company.
Bell Telephone's venture into radio broadcasting began in 1927, when it began a series of experimental broadcasts.

Together, they were able to demonstrate the usefulness of the telephone and demand for a telephone rapidly rose in the following years.The Bell System soon dominated telephone service in the United States.
q3.questionContent: Who was issued the first patent for a telephone?

options.sentence: Bell Telephone Company popularized the telephone in the US.
Alexander Graham Bell invented a telephone that used copper wire.
The telephone was a keystone tool in modern society.
Telephone services were first used by the wealthy.
